titleStmt.title: The Turkes secretorie conteining his sundrie letters sent to diuers emperours, kings, princes and states, full of proud bragges, and bloody threatnings: with seuerall answers to the same, both pithie and peremptorie. Translated truly out of the Latine copie.
Epistolae magni Turci. English
titleStmt.author: Mehmed II, Sultan of the Turks, 1432-1481.

titleStmt.title: The Turkes secretorie conteining his sundrie letters sent to diuers emperours, kings, princes and states, full of proud bragges, and bloody threatnings: with seuerall answers to the same, both pithie and peremptorie. Translated truly out of the Latine copie.
Epistolae magni Turci. English
titleStmt.author: Mehmed II, Sultan of the Turks, 1432-1481.
Laudivio, de Vezzano.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by M[elchisedec] B[radwood] and are to be solde at the Swan in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: A translation of "Epistolae magni Turci", compiled by Laudivio de Vezzano and sometimes attributed to him.
Running title reads: The Turkes secretorie. 1607.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

person.persName: Mehmed Sultan of the Turks, II,
